Services.Local.VPN.OpenVPN.Client.Get.summary: Retrieves the status and configuration parameters in regards to the OpenVPN Client.

ARGUMENT_DATA_TYPE_MISMATCH.description: A call attempt to a valid object and procedure was performed, however an argument value was provided with an unexpected data type, therefore it was not possible to process the request.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "ARGUMENT_DATA_TYPE_MISMATCH", "Description": "Unable to process the request because the value provided on the \u2018Enabled\u2019 field is not a valid Boolean."}}

ARGUMENT_NOT_FOUND.description: A call to a valid object and procedure was performed, however an unrecognized argument was provided, therefore it was not possible to process the request.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "ARGUMENT_NOT_FOUND", "Description": "Unable to process the request because 'Enabled' is not a valid argument."}}

ARGUMENT_REQUIRED_MISSING.description: A call to a valid object and procedure was performed, however a required argument was not provided, therefore it was not possible to process the request.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "ARGUMENT_REQUIRED_MISSING", "Description": "Unable to process the request because the 'Enabled' field was not provided."}}

ARGUMENT_VALUE_NOT_SUPPORTED.description: A call attempt to a valid object and procedure was performed, however a non-supported argument value was provided, therefore it was not possible to process the request.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "ARGUMENT_VALUE_NOT_SUPPORTED", "Description": "Unable to process the request because \u2018Red\u2019 is not a value supported by the \u2018Colour\u2019 field."}}

METHOD_NOT_FOUND.description: A call to a valid object but non-existing procedure was performed, therefore it was not possible to process the request.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "METHOD_NOT_FOUND", "Description": "Unable to process the request because 'Set' is not a valid method"}}

OBJECT_NOT_FOUND.description: A call to a non-existing object was performed, therefore it was not possible to process the request.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "OBJECT_NOT_FOUND", "Description": "Unable to process the request because 'prpl.Dummy' is not a valid object."}}

OK.description: A well-formed request to an authorized resource was performed, and the receiver was able to compute the response within the allowed time-window.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "OK"}}

OPERATION_ALREADY_IN_PROGRESS.description: A well-formed request to an authorized resource was performed, however the operation could not be completed, as the required resource was temporarily locked by a different request in progress.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "OPERATION_ALREADY_IN_PROGRESS", "Description": "Unable to process the request because there is a duplicate operation currently in progress."}}

OPERATION_ERROR.description: A well-formed request was performed however, it was not possible to process the request due to an unknown internal error.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "OPERATION_ERROR", "Description": "Unable to process the request because there is a configuration error."}}

OPERATION_ILLEGAL.description: A well-formed request to an authorized resource was performed, however the operation could not be completed, as it was invoked in the incorrect system state or order.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "OPERATION_ILLEGAL", "Description": "Unable to process the request because the 'Stop' procedure can only be invoked after the 'Start' method has been called."}}

OPERATION_PERMISSION_DENIED.description: A well-formed request was performed however, the client did not meet the security conditions required to access the protected resource, therefore it is not possible to process the request.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "OPERATION_PERMISSION_DENIED", "Description": "Unable to process the request because user \u2018Admin\u2019 does not have access privileges to invoke the \u2018Set\u2019 procedure on object \u2018prpl.Dummy\u2019."}}

OPERATION_TIMEOUT.description: A well-formed request was performed however, it was not possible to process the response within the allowed time-frame.

application/json.example: {"Header": {"Name": "OPERATION_TIMEOUT", "Description": "The operation has been aborted because the service did not respond within the expected 5 seconds time-frame."}}

Services.Local.VPN.OpenVPN.Client.ResetS.summary: Resets the statistics counters of the OpenVPN Client.

Password.possible_values: any string with length from 1 up to 64 chars

Username.possible_values: any string with length from 1 up to 64 chars

application/json.example: {"Enabled": true, "Remote": {"Address": "22.2.4.2", "Port": 1194, "Protocol": "UDP", "Username": "prplFoundation", "Password": "abc123"}, "Interfaces": {"Outbound": "Interfaces.IP.ffth_dhcp", "Inbound": "Interfaces.IP.br0"}, "Statistics": {"Bytes": {"Transmitted": 0, "Received": 0}, "Frames": {"Transmitted": 0, "Received": 0}}}

Limit.description: How many items to return at one time (max 200)

Offset.description: Which object index to start with

Response.description: schema for a responses to object methods

Header.description: Header object specifying the name of the response type and providing a detailed description in case of an error
Header object specifying the name of the response type and providing a detailed description in case of an error

Description.description: A more detailed error message. NOTE: only filled in when the operation returns an error.

Username.possible_values: any string with length from 1 up to 64 chars

Password.possible_values: any string with length from 1 up to 64 chars

SERVICES_LOCAL_VPN_OPENVPN_CLIENT_CONNEC.description: Raised when a OpenVPN Client connects.

SERVICES_LOCAL_VPN_OPENVPN_CLIENT_DISABL.description: Raised when an existing OpenVPN Client is disabled. This does not necessarily result from a configuration change of the administrative state field, but rather when it becomes operationally inactive or fails to start.

SERVICES_LOCAL_VPN_OPENVPN_CLIENT_DISCON.description: Raised when a OpenVPN Client disconnects.

SERVICES_LOCAL_VPN_OPENVPN_CLIENT_ENABLE.description: Raised when an existing OpenVPN Client is enabled. This does not necessarily result from a configuration change of the administrative state field, but rather when it becomes operationally active.

SERVICES_LOCAL_VPN_OPENVPN_CLIENT_MODIFI.description: Raised when an existing OpenVPN Client is modified. Updating the administrative state should also result in the event being triggered.
